briefTitle: Efficacy and Safety of Alisporivir Triple Therapy in Chronic Hepatitis C Genotype 1 Treatment-naïve Participants

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion criteria:

* Chronic HCV infection
* HCV genotype 1
* No previous treatment for hepatitis C infection
* Serum HCV RNA level ≥ 1000 IU/ml assessed by quantitative polymerase chain reaction or equivalent at screening, no upper limit
* Liver evaluation prior to baseline: liver biopsy within 3 years or Fibroscan within 6 months

Exclusion criteria:

* HCV genotype different from genotype 1 or co-infection with other HCV genotype
* Co-infection with Hepatitis B or HIV
* Any other cause of relevant liver disease other than HCV
* Presence or history of hepatic decompensation
* Alanine aminotransferase (ALT) ≥ 10 times upper limit of normal (ULN), more than 1 episode of elevated bilirubin (\> ULN) in past 6 months

Other protocol-defined inclusion/exclusion criteria may apply.

outcomeMeasures.title: Percentage of Participants Who Achieved Sustained Virologic Response (SVR) 12 Weeks After the End of Treatment (SVR12)
outcomeMeasures.description: SVR12 was defined as hepatitis C virus (HCV) RNA laboratory value below the level of quantification (\< LOQ; i.e., 25 IU/ml) 12 weeks after the end of treatment.

outcomeMeasures.title: Percentage of Participants Who Achieved SVR 24 Weeks After the End of Treatment (SVR24)
outcomeMeasures.description: SVR24 was defined as HCV RNA laboratory value \< LOQ 24 weeks after the end of treatment.

outcomeMeasures.title: Percentage of Participants With Rapid Virologic Response (RVR) After 4 Weeks of Treatment (RVR4)
outcomeMeasures.description: RVR4 was defined as serum HCV RNA \< LOQ after 4 weeks of treatment.

outcomeMeasures.title: Percentage of Participants With Early Virologic Response (EVR) After 12 Weeks of Treatment
outcomeMeasures.description: EVR was defined as a ≥ 2 log10 decrease in HCV RNA or HCV RNA \< LOQ after 12 weeks of treatment.

outcomeMeasures.title: Percentage of Participants With Partial Early Virologic Response (pEVR) After 12 Weeks of Treatment
outcomeMeasures.description: pEVR was defined as a ≥ 2 log10 decrease in HCV RNA and still detectable (≥ LOQ) after 12 weeks of treatment.

outcomeMeasures.title: Percentage of Participants With Complete Early Virologic Response (cEVR) After 12 Weeks of Treatment
outcomeMeasures.description: cEVR was defined as serum HCV RNA \< LOQ after 12 weeks of treatment.

outcomeMeasures.title: Percentage of Participants With Extended Rapid Virologic Response (eRVR) From 4 to 12 Weeks of Treatment
outcomeMeasures.description: eRVR was defined as achieving RVR4 and maintaining HCV RNA \< LOQ until Week 12.

outcomeMeasures.title: Percentage of Participants With End of Treatment Response (ETR) at Treatment End Within 48 Weeks
outcomeMeasures.description: ETR was defined as serum HCV RNA \< LOQ at treatment end (completed or prematurely discontinued).

outcomeMeasures.title: Percentage of Participants With Alanine Aminotransferase (ALT) Abnormalities Within 48 Weeks
outcomeMeasures.description:
ALT abnormalities were summarized as participants who had either:

* ALT \> 2 x upper limit of normal (ULN) during the study and \> 2 x ULN at baseline
* ALT \> 3 x ULN during the study and \> 2 x ULN at baseline

outcomeMeasures.title: Percentage of Participants With Grade 3 or 4 Anemia During Treatment Within 48 Weeks
outcomeMeasures.description:
Grading was according to the Modified Division of Microbiology \& Infectious Diseases (DMID) Toxicity Tables (version 2.0).

Participants with multiple abnormalities were counted only once in the worst category.

outcomeMeasures.title: Percentage of Participants With Grade 3 or 4 Neutropenia During Treatment Within 48 Weeks
outcomeMeasures.description: Grading was according to the DMID Toxicity Tables (version 2.0). Participants with multiple abnormalities were counted only once in the worst category.

outcomeMeasures.title: Percentage of Participants With Grade 3 or 4 Thrombocytopenia During Treatment Within 48 Weeks
outcomeMeasures.description: Grading was according to the DMID Toxicity Tables (version 2.0). Participants with multiple abnormalities were counted only once in the worst category.
